intro: Cephalocroton pueschelii, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
